name: Introduction to Archaeology
description: This course introduces students to the field of archaeology. Students will learn about the history of archaeology, key principles, and different methodological approaches used in the field.

name: Archaeological Field Methods
description: This course covers the field techniques used to excavate archaeological sites. Students will learn how to survey, excavate, document, and analyze sites.

name: Archaeological Laboratory Methods
description: This course focuses on the methods used to analyze artifacts and other archaeological material in a laboratory setting. Students will learn how to process, analyze, and interpret archaeological evidence.

name: Industrial Archaeology
description: This course introduces students to the subfield of Industrial Archaeology. Students will learn about the history of industrialization, key principles of industrial archaeology, and different methodological approaches used to study industrial sites.
